definitions.definition: So as to form a circle or trace a circular path, or approximation thereof.
So as to surround or be near.
examples: There isn't another house for miles around .
An adult elephant weighs around five tons.
There are rumors going around that the company is bankrupt.
Look around and see what you find.
We moved the furniture around in the living room.

definitions.definition: From one state or condition to an opposite or very different one; with a metaphorical change in direction; bringing about awareness or agreement.
examples: The team wasn't doing well, but the new coach really turned things around .
He used to stay up late but his new girlfriend changed that around .
The patient was unconscious but the doctor brought him around quickly.
I didn't think he would ever like the new design, but eventually we brought him around .

definitions.definition: So as to partially or completely rotate ; so as to face in the opposite direction .
examples: Turn around at the end of this street.
She spun around a few times.

definitions.definition: Used with verbs to indicate repeated or continuous action, or in numerous locations or with numerous people.
examples: I asked around , and no-one really liked it.
Shopping around can get you a better deal.
When are you going to stop whoring around , find a nice girl, and give us grandchildren?

definitions.definition: Used with certain verbs to suggest unproductive activity.
examples: sit around , mess around , loaf around

main_definition: So as to form a circle or trace a circular path, or approximation thereof.
secondary_definitions: So as to surround or be near.
From one state or condition to an opposite or very different one; with a metaphorical change in direction; bringing about awareness or agreement.
( with turn , spin , etc. ) So as to partially or completely rotate ; so as to face in the opposite direction .
Used with verbs to indicate repeated or continuous action, or in numerous locations or with numerous people.
Used with certain verbs to suggest unproductive activity.
